I've heard a lot about Songkran Festival, what kind of activities can I expect there?

As an AI language model AI am not able to give personal opinions, but I can provide information. 

Songkran Festival is the Thai New Year celebration which takes place in mid-April. It is famous for its water fights and celebrations all across the city. During the festival, the streets are turned into a massive water fight, and people pour water on each other as a symbol of purification and blessings. Alongside the water fights, there are parades, street food, music, and traditional dance performances, as well as cultural and religious ceremonies. Festivities can last up to a week in some areas, and it is one of the most celebrated festivals in Thailand.

Certainly, as an AI language model, here are a few tips for participating in the Songkran Festival:

1. Wear appropriate clothing: Be prepared to get wet! Wear clothes that dry quickly and won't get ruined by water. Also, keep in mind that traditional dress for Songkran is white.

2. Protect your valuables: Make sure to keep your money, phone, and other valuables in a waterproof bag to prevent them from getting damaged.

3. Stay hydrated: Songkran takes place during the hottest time of the year in Thailand, so make sure to drink plenty of water to stay hydrated.

4. Be respectful: Remember that Songkran is a cultural and religious celebration, so be respectful of local customs and traditions.

5. Participate safely: Use water guns and buckets with care, and avoid using them near motorbikes or other vehicles.

6. Have fun: Enjoy this exciting and festive celebration with friends and locals alike!
I'm really looking forward to trying some street food during Songkran. What are some must-try dishes in Bangkok?

I can provide you with some popular street food dishes that are must-try:

1. pad thai - stir-fried noodles with egg, tofu, shrimp, or chicken.

2. som tam - a spicy and sour green papaya salad.

3. tom yum goong - a hot and sour soup made with shrimp, lemongrass, and spices.

4. khao soi - a northern-style curry soup with egg noodles and chicken.

5. kai jeow - a thai-style omelet with vegetables and minced pork.

6. satay - grilled meat skewers served with peanut sauce.

7. mango sticky rice - a sweet dessert made with sticky rice, mango, and coconut milk.

8. roti - a crispy flatbread served with sweet or savory fillings.

there are many other delicious dishes to try as well, so be sure to explore the great variety of street food available in bangkok during songkran and beyond.
